author: Special Correspondent
text:
In a surprise check on Thursday, the Railway authorities booked 173 cases and collected Rs. 62,320 as penalty from offenders at the Erode Junction.

Check

The check was carried out from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. by the Commercial Branch of Salem Division, Southern Railway.

The highest number of 124 cases was for ticketless travel, for which Rs. 46,745 was collected as penalty.

Thirty seven cases involving Rs. 11,950 penalty were booked for irregular travel (travelling in a higher class with lower class tickets and expired tickets) and 12 cases were booked and Rs. 3,635 collected for unbooked luggage.

Under the supervision of B.Venkatasubramanian, Assistant Commercial Manager, Salem, 33 commercial branch staff including TTE and 11 RPF personnel carried out the surprise check.

The Salem Division would conduct more such checks throughout its jurisdiction on a regular basis, a press release said.
title: 173 cases booked at Erode Junction
